finx.base_classes.base_client¶

author: dick mule purpose: Base Client interface that underpins REST and SOCKET implementations

Classes¶

PayloadCache

Payload object to manage state internally

BaseFinXClient

Base FinX Client interface - will initialize a context manager and session manager

async coverage_check(security_id, **kwargs)¶

Returns a list of covered securities. Check to see if a security id is covered by FinX SecurityDB.

>>> # SAMPLE USAGE
>>> finx_client.coverage_check(security_id='38376R3H7')
Parameters:

  • security_id (str) – Security ID

  • kwargs (dict) – Keyword arguments

Returns:

Results from the API

async calculate_greeks(s0, k, r, sigma, q, T, price, option_side=None, option_type=None, **kwargs)¶

Calculate greeks function

Parameters:

  • s0 (float) – Initial price

  • k (float) – Strike price

  • r (float) – Risk-free rate

  • sigma (float) – Volatility

  • q (float) – Dividend yield

  • T (float) – Time to maturity

  • price (float) – Price of the option

  • option_side (Optional[str]) – Side of the option (i.e. call or put)

  • option_type (Optional[str]) – Type of the option (i.e. european or american)

  • kwargs (dict) – Keyword arguments

Returns:

Results from the API

Return type:

dict

async get_security_cash_flows(security_id, as_of_date=None, price=100.0, lognormal=False, volatility=1.0, drift_a=1.0, yield_shift=100.0, shock_in_bp=0.0, price_as_yield=False, cpr=-9999.0, psa=-9999.0, use_test_data=False, **kwargs)¶

Get security cash flows function

Parameters:

  • security_id (str) – Security ID

  • as_of_date (Optional[str]) – Date to get security cash flows for

  • price (Optional[float]) – Price of the security

  • lognormal (Optional[bool]) – Lognormal distribution

  • volatility (Optional[float]) – Volatility

  • drift_a (Optional[float]) – Mean Reversion

  • yield_shift (Optional[float]) – Yield shift

  • shock_in_bp (Optional[float]) – Shock in basis points

  • price_as_yield (Optional[bool | str]) – Price as yield

  • cpr (Optional[float]) – CPR

  • psa (Optional[float]) – PSA

  • use_test_data (Optional[bool]) – Use test data

  • kwargs (dict) – Keyword arguments

async forecast_cf_and_prices(security_id, as_of_date=None, price=100.0, lognormal=False, volatility=1.0, drift_a=1.0, yield_shift=100.0, shock_in_bp=0.0, price_as_yield=False, skip_projections=True, is_spread_shock=False, reindex_frequency=None, cpr=-9999.0, psa=-9999.0, reporting_dates_only=False, post_convert_currency=None, use_reference_curve=False, use_test_data=False, reset_convention=None, alt_security_id=None, inflation_type=None, **kwargs)¶

Forecast cash flows and prices function

Parameters:

  • security_id (str) – Security ID

  • as_of_date (Optional[str]) – Date to forecast cash flows and prices for

  • price (Optional[float]) – Price of the security

  • lognormal (Optional[bool]) – Lognormal distribution

  • volatility (Optional[float]) – Volatility

  • drift_a (Optional[float]) – Mean Reversion

  • yield_shift (Optional[float]) – Yield shift

  • shock_in_bp (Optional[float]) – Shock in basis points

  • price_as_yield (Optional[bool | str]) – Price as yield

  • skip_projections (Optional[bool]) – Skip projections

  • is_spread_shock (Optional[bool]) – Spread shock

  • reindex_frequency (Optional[int]) – Reindex frequency (12 = monthly)

  • cpr (Optional[float]) – CPR

  • psa (Optional[float]) – PSA

  • reporting_dates_only (Optional[bool]) – Reporting dates only

  • post_convert_currency (Optional[str]) – Post convert currency

  • use_reference_curve (Optional[bool]) – Use reference curve

  • use_test_data (Optional[bool]) – Use test data

  • reset_convention (Optional[str]) – Reset convention

  • alt_security_id (Optional[str]) – Alternative security ID

  • inflation_type (Optional[str]) – Inflation type

  • kwargs (dict) – Keyword arguments

Returns:

Results from the API

Return type:

dict
